instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.5V_S5: What is 5V_S5? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S5” which is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 state. .
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Wont start missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
so i've received a liquid damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a in today. Liquid damage was focussed around the <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> area. I've cleaned it all and visibly inspected the area - resoldered <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> as pins 31 and 26 were not shiny anymore. 
If I connect charger it negotiates to 20v as expected but with a tiny spike to 0.07a current draw then drops to 0.00a. PPBUS is present at 13V but there is no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> is not shorted to ground either. I'm wondering if this is a dead <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> or if water damage at <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> might've killed <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>.

<CHIP>U7800</CHIP> area is clean

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Wont start missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
First check diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL>.

Post basic voltages for <CHIP>U7650</CHIP>; pins 23, 12, 13, 22, 29, 21, 4.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Wont start missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
diode mode reading is 0.455 to ground on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
pin 23 -13.06v
pin 12 - 0v
pin 13 - 0v
pin 22 - 3.3v
pin 29 - 0v
pin 21 - 0v
pin 4 - 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Wont start missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Check <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> (7 OF 10) LDO outputs at page 60.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Wont start missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Wont start missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Wont start missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Wont start missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7828</RESISTOR>/29, which one is present on the board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Wont start missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7828</RESISTOR> is the one present, <RESISTOR>R7829</RESISTOR> is not

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Wont start missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Check if <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> goes high.
If not, you may need to reball/replace SMC.
Also check signals and voltages at <CHIP>U5000</CHIP> (SYM 2 OF 2) at page 39.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Wont start missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is high 3.4V
<SIGNAL>BUF_SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is high 3.4v
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S5_SMC_VDD</SIGNAL> - 1.2v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_SMC_VDD</SIGNAL> - 3.4v

also of note but probably not important right now L6600 and L6601 are missing. They appear to be just for audio so i'm not too concerned about them right now!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Wont start missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Looks like PMIC issue.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R7883</RESISTOR> is good.

Do you get <SIGNAL>3V1_RTC</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Wont start missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message: <SIGNAL>3V1_RTC</SIGNAL> is 0.023V so i'd say not there! PMIC issue then?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Wont start missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Wont start missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Well i've pulled the PMIC and i've still got a 5ohm short to ground on <SIGNAL>3V1_RTC</SIGNAL>. PCH i'm guessing?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Wont start missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
A small chance to be one of <CAPACITOR>C7922</CAPACITOR>, or <CAPACITOR>C1227</CAPACITOR>/8.
Very likely bad PCH...
